intro: Oligogynium poissonii, commonly known as the Poisson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized bracts that resemble petals. Oligogynium poissonii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its distinctive appearance.
